channel.title: Vector Search on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Vector Search on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: dotnet: Secure and Intelligent: Queryable Encryption and Vector Search in MongoDB EF Core Provider
item.description:
The MongoDB EF Core provider adds support for Queryable Encryption and Vector Search, letting .NET developers encrypt sensitive data while still running queries against it and build AI-powered semantic search applications directly using EF Core.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: ai: How to debug and optimize RAG agents in Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
This tutorial shows how to evaluate and optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) agents in Microsoft Foundry using Foundry Observability. It recommends running end-to-end, reference-free RAG triad evaluators (Groundedness and Relevance) and applying advanced search and retrieval tuning before deployment.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure SQL Database DiskANN vector indexing
item.description:
Azure announces public preview of DiskANN-based vector indexing in Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, and SQL databases in Microsoft Fabric, enabling efficient disk-based approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) vector similarity search inside relational database services.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Float16 data type for vector indexes in Azure Cosmos DB
item.description:
Azure Cosmos DB now generally supports the float16 (half-precision) data type for vector indexes, letting you store and query vectors with half-precision floats to reduce storage needs compared with float32.

  • Source: Azure Updates
